description: Comprehensive test cases for HomeworkManager component covering UI, functionality, accessibility, API integration, and edge cases

testCases.description: Verify HomeworkManager page loads with correct layout on mobile devices
steps: Set viewport to mobile size (320px width)
Verify single column layout is displayed
Verify all elements are stacked vertically
testCases.expectedResult: Page displays in single column layout with properly sized touch targets

testCases.description: Verify responsive design across all breakpoints
steps: Verify layout changes appropriately at each breakpoint
testCases.expectedResult: Layout adapts correctly to each breakpoint with appropriate column counts and element arrangements

steps: Verify light theme colors are applied
Verify dark theme colors are applied
Verify teal theme colors are applied
testCases.expectedResult: All three themes (light, dark, teal) are applied correctly with proper color schemes

testCases.description: Verify homework list displays with proper formatting
steps: Verify homework items are displayed in list format
Check serial numbers are visible and formatted correctly
Verify subject, title, and message fields are displayed
Check that action buttons are visible (max 3 per row)
Verify file attachments are shown with proper icons
testCases.expectedResult: Homework list displays all required fields with proper formatting and maximum 3 action buttons per row

testCases.description: Verify filter modal opens and displays correctly
steps: Check that all filter options are available
Verify search input field is present
Check that apply and clear filter buttons are visible
testCases.expectedResult: Filter modal opens with all filter options, search field, and action buttons visible

steps: Upload files (PDF, DOC, JPG, PNG, Excel)
testCases.expectedResult: New homework is created successfully with all provided data and appears in the list

steps: Click 'Edit' button on existing homework item
testCases.expectedResult: Homework item is updated with new data and changes are reflected in the list

steps: Verify homework item is removed from list
testCases.expectedResult: Confirmation dialog appears and homework item is deleted after confirmation

steps: Drag and drop files onto upload area
Verify supported file types (PDF, DOC, DOCX, JPG, PNG, XLS, XLSX) are accepted
Verify file size validation (max 10MB per file)
Verify maximum file count validation (max 10 files)
Verify files are attached to homework
testCases.expectedResult: Files are uploaded successfully with proper validation and progress indication

steps: Verify all homework items are shown
testCases.expectedResult: Filters are applied correctly and results are filtered as expected, clear filters resets to show all items
All notification settings are saved and can be toggled independently

steps: Navigate to HomeworkManager page using keyboard only
Use Tab key to navigate through all interactive elements
Use Arrow keys to navigate through homework list items
Use Enter key to activate buttons and links
Use Escape key to close modals
testCases.expectedResult: All interactive elements are accessible via keyboard with visible focus indicators

testCases.description: Verify ARIA labels and screen reader support
steps: Navigate to HomeworkManager page with screen reader
Verify all buttons have descriptive ARIA labels
Check that form fields have proper labels
Check that dynamic states are announced (aria-expanded, aria-selected)
testCases.expectedResult: Screen reader can navigate and understand all page elements with proper ARIA labels

steps: Press Tab to focus on skip navigation links
Verify focus moves to appropriate sections
Check that landmark roles are properly defined
testCases.expectedResult: Skip navigation links work correctly and focus moves to appropriate page sections

steps: Verify all elements are visible and readable
Check that information is not conveyed by color alone
Verify contrast ratios meet WCAG 2.1 AA standards
Test all interactive elements are accessible
testCases.expectedResult: Page is fully functional and accessible in high contrast mode with proper contrast ratios

testCases.description: Verify live regions for dynamic content
steps: Navigate to HomeworkManager page with screen reader
Perform actions that change content (create, edit, delete homework)
Check that loading states are announced
Check that success messages are announced
testCases.expectedResult: Screen reader announces all dynamic content changes including loading, success, and error states

steps: Verify homework list loads from API
Check that loading state is shown during API call
Verify error handling if API fails
testCases.expectedResult: Homework data is successfully loaded from API with proper loading states and error handling

steps: Create new homework with all required fields
Verify API call is made to /api/homework with POST method
Check that success response is handled
Verify new homework appears in list
Test error handling for API failures
testCases.expectedResult: New homework is successfully created via API and appears in the list

steps: Verify API call is made to /api/homework/:id with PUT method
Check that success response is handled
Verify changes are reflected in the list
Test error handling for API failures
testCases.expectedResult: Homework is successfully updated via API and changes are reflected in the list

steps: Verify API call is made to /api/homework/:id with DELETE method
Check that success response is handled
Verify homework is removed from list
Test error handling for API failures
testCases.expectedResult: Homework is successfully deleted via API and removed from the list

steps: Upload files (PDF, DOC, JPG, PNG, Excel)
Verify API call is made to /api/upload with POST method
Check that file URLs are returned
Verify files are attached to homework
Test error handling for upload failures
testCases.expectedResult: Files are successfully uploaded via API and attached to homework

testCases.description: Verify handling of large homework lists with virtual scrolling
steps: Navigate to HomeworkManager page with 1000+ homework items
Check that only visible items are rendered
Check that all items are accessible
testCases.expectedResult: Large lists are handled efficiently with virtual scrolling and good performance

testCases.description: Verify handling of invalid file uploads
steps: Try to upload unsupported file types
Try to upload files larger than 10MB
Try to upload more than 10 files
Verify appropriate error messages are shown
Check that invalid uploads are rejected
testCases.expectedResult: Invalid file uploads are properly rejected with clear error messages

testCases.description: Verify handling of network connectivity issues
steps: Check that pending changes are applied
testCases.expectedResult: Application handles offline scenarios gracefully with proper data synchronization

testCases.description: Verify handling of concurrent user modifications
steps: Open HomeworkManager page in multiple browser tabs
Edit same homework item in different tabs
Check that last saved changes are preserved
testCases.expectedResult: Concurrent modifications are handled properly with conflict resolution

testCases.description: Verify handling of special characters in homework data
steps: Create homework with special characters in title and message
Include Unicode characters, emojis, and symbols
Verify data is stored and displayed correctly
Test search functionality with special characters
Check that filtering works with special characters
testCases.expectedResult: Special characters are handled correctly in all homework data fields and operations

testCases.description: Verify handling of extremely long text inputs
steps: Create homework with maximum length title (200 characters)
Check that UI handles long text properly
Test editing of long text fields
testCases.expectedResult: Maximum length inputs are handled correctly with proper UI display and data storage

testCases.description: Verify handling of rapid user interactions
steps: Check that all actions are processed correctly
testCases.expectedResult: Rapid user interactions are handled correctly without race conditions or UI freezing

testCases.description: Verify handling of browser back/forward navigation
steps: Check that unsaved changes are handled
testCases.expectedResult: Browser navigation works correctly with proper state preservation and unsaved changes handling
